qas.question: What video game console uses infrared LEDs?
What device uses infrared LEDs to measure oxygen saturation?
Some flatbed scanners use what type of LED?
By using LEDs, scanners do not have to what?
Grow lights use LEDs for what process?

non- What device uses infrared LEDs to measure oxygen saturation?
Some flatbed scanners use what type of what?

context: Many sensor systems rely on light as the signal source. LEDs are often ideal as a light source due to the requirements of the sensors. LEDs are used as motion sensors, for example in optical computer mice. The <a0_0><b5_0>Nintendo Wii<a0_0/>'s<b5_0/> sensor bar uses infrared LEDs. <a1_0><b6_0>Pulse oximeters<b6_0/><a1_0/> use them for measuring oxygen saturation. Some flatbed scanners use arrays of <a2_0>RGB LEDs<a2_0/> rather than the typical cold-cathode fluorescent lamp as the light source. Having independent control of three illuminated colors allows the scanner to calibrate itself for more accurate color balance, and there is no need for <a3_0>warm-up<a3_0/>. Further, its sensors only need be monochromatic, since at any one time the page being scanned is only lit by one color of light. Since LEDs can also be used as photodiodes, they can be used for both photo emission and detection. This could be used, for example, in a touchscreen that registers reflected light from a finger or stylus. Many materials and biological systems are sensitive to, or dependent on, light. Grow lights use LEDs to <a4_0>increase photosynthesis in plants<a4_0/>, and bacteria and viruses can be removed from water and other substances using <b7_0>UV LEDs<b7_0/> for sterilization.
